results.title: Eve Arnold in retrospect
results.creator_credit: Beeban Kidron, Spencer Style, BBC and Wonderland
results.brief_description: Eve Arnold, member of the celebrated Magnum photographic agency since 1957 is the subject of this informative documentary which looks not only at her work, but the influence her life experiences have had on her art. Her extensive portfolio of work includes many well known figures and has captured some of the centuries memorable moments. Subjects include; Margaret Thatcher, Malcolm X, Marilyn Monroe, Marlene Dietrich, Joan Crawford, plus many more celebrities, places and faces.

results.title: Evariste Galois
results.brief_description:
Evariste Galois made significant contributions to several branches of mathematics, particularly in the domain of equations. Astruc follows what is to be Galois’s last night before he is killed in a duel. Narrated by Jean Negroni.

Credits: Producer, Jean Salvy ; director, writer, Alexandre Astruc ; photography, Jacques Mercanton ; music, Antoine Duhamel.
Cast: Jose Varela, Vincent Kaldor, Francois Perrot, Gerard Dauzat, Jean Sobieski.

results.title: Ukraine wins Eurovision
results.brief_description: Watch the moment that the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest winner was announced. A profound moment for Ukraine amidst the current political climate across the war-torn nation, as reflected by Kalush Orchestra band mate’s acceptance speech states; “This victory is for every Ukrainian!” The six-member band received special permission to leave the country to represent Ukraine.
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

“This victory is for every Ukranian!” Kalush Orchestra declared when they won the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest with ‘Stefania’. The folk-rap group received special permission to travel to the competition in Turin, Italy from war-torn Ukraine. Ukranian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated the band via the Telegram messaging app. Since Russia invaded Ukraine 13 weeks ago, Zelenskyy has harnessed the power of social media to spread a message of defiance, appearing in low-fi broadcasts from his phone, often in military fatigues, to condemn the invasion and rally international support. His recorded messages have also been incorporated into other competitions and award shows, including the Grammys and Oscars.
description_for_label: “This victory is for every Ukranian!” Kalush Orchestra declared when they won the 2022 Eurovision Song Contest with ‘Stefania’. The folk-rap group received special permission to travel to the competition in Turin, Italy from war-torn Ukraine. Ukranian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy congratulated the band via the Telegram messaging app. Since Russia invaded Ukraine 13 weeks ago, Zelenskyy has harnessed the power of social media to spread a message of defiance, appearing in low-fi broadcasts from his phone, often in military fatigues, to condemn the invasion and rally international support.

results.title: European Art School: 4
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: The final of the ‘European Art School’ series, this program discusses guidelines for composition in a range of artistic work including painting and drawing. It outlines how shapes can be geometrical, natural or abstract and the varying effects, some positive, others negative, that this can have on composition. The program also covers how other elements in art, such as balance, colour and movement, can be used to create contrasting or unifying values in the composition of an art work.

results.title: European Art School: 3
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: In this third program, Mario Massanyi and his colleagues explain and explore the principles involved in the use of colour in drawing and painting. They discuss methods of creating your own colour combinations to create varying tints and shades and the evocative qualities of colour to create mood and texture. In painting particularly, they demonstrate the effective methods of creating such mood and texture through the application of paint in a variety of different ways.

results.title: European Art School: 1
results.creator_credit: Anders Holmertz and European Art School
results.brief_description: Presented by Mario Massanyi and his colleagues this program presents an easy to follow guide to basic drawing and the range of preferred tools that can be used in the process. It covers techniques such as contour drawing, gesture drawing and modelling and highlights practical examples for practicing drawing skills. The episode ends with a tour of a pencil factory where some of the materials discussed earlier in the program are looked at in detail.

results.title: Eureka stockade
results.creator_credit: Harry Watt, Leslie Norman, Sir Michael Balcon and Ealing Studios
results.brief_description: In 1854, the government instigated moves designed to drive the gold miners from Eureka Hill goldfields. The miners showed their opposition to the move by revolting. The legendary leader Peter Lalor is portrayed by Chips Rafferty. Cast includes: Peter Finch, Jane Barrett, Jack Lambert, Gordon Jackson.

results.title: Eumig 8mm Film Splicer
results.brief_description: Eumig splicer in box with instruction booklet in German, Italian and English. This object was originally catalogued in the East Anglian Film Archive Donation with a Eumig P8 Projector (E000255) and Prora 8mm Editor Viewer. Catalogue entries separated.

results.title: Eternal sunshine of the spotless mind
results.creator_credit: Michel Gondry, Anthony Bregman, Steve Golin and Focus Features
results.brief_description: Joel (Jim Carrey) and Clementine’s (Kate Winslet) relationship isn’t going too well so she engages a psychiatrist to employ a process whereby Joel and the relationship is erased from her memory. On finding out about the procedure Joel thinks he’ll do the same but the couple actually re-discover more about the start of their relationship and what brought them together in the first place. In a quirky look at relationships, break-ups and a kind of love-conquers-all mystique this romantic/black comedy stems from the same key team that put together “Human Nature” - director Michel Gondry and writer Charlie Kaufman. Cast includes Kirsten Dunst, Mark Ruffalo, Elijah Wood, Tom Wilkinson.

results.title: Le Quattrocento
results.brief_description:
Episode 14 of Series “Il Etait Une Fois L’homme” (= “Once Upon a Time Man”).
The Quattrocento was a period of prosperity and steady progression in the arts toward the harmonious balance achieved in the High Renaissance. In concrete terms, the Quattrocento is regarded as beginning in 1401 with a competition to design the eastern doors for the Baptistery in Florence and ending in 1503 with the election of Cardinal Giuliano della Rovere as Pope Julius II. Reference: Encyclopedia Britannica.

Credits: Director, writer, Albert Barille ; photography, Jean-Louis Karcher ; art direction, Philippe Landrot, Rene Borg ; graphic research, Jean Barbaud.
Cast: Roger Carel, Francine Laine, Pierre Trabaud, Henri Djanik [original French narration].
